result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen D Taylor

10:02 AM Defendant Stephen D Taylor not in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Stephen D Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Atty Ramirez indicates he is not sure where the defendant is at this time since the bond was not posted here.

BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. STAYED UNTIL NEXT DATE.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

8:32 AM Defendant Stephen D Taylor appeared by video, in custody at KCJ.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Stephen D Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant.
Defense indicates they got in contact and scheduled this date right after the missed date and was picked up on the matter in Kenosha over the weekend, requests reinstatement. 
State defers to Court. 
BTC: Court will increase bond by $500 with same prior conditions.
